parametrized_description: A cleaning company aims to maximize exposure for promoting a new product without exceeding AdvertisingBudget. They allocate funds to two advertising methods: radio ads and social media ads. Each radio ad incurs a cost of CostRadioAd and yields ExposureRadioAd expected viewers. Each social media ad costs CostSocialMediaAd and generates ExposureSocialMediaAd expected viewers. The company decides that the number of radio ads must be at least MinRadioAds and at most MaxRadioAds, and that at least MinSocialMediaAds social media ads should be contracted. Determine the number of each type of advertisement to maximize total exposure while remaining within the advertising budget.

CostSocialMediaAd.description: Cost of one social media advertisement

ExposureRadioAd.description: Expected exposure (viewers) for each radio advertisement

ExposureSocialMediaAd.description: Expected exposure (viewers) for each social media advertisement

MinRadioAds.description: Minimum number of radio advertisements to be ordered

MaxRadioAds.description: Maximum number of radio advertisements to be ordered

MinSocialMediaAds.description: Minimum number of social media advertisements to be contracted

NumberRadioAds.description: The number of radio advertisements to be ordered

NumberSocialMediaAds.description: The number of social media advertisements to be contracted

constraints.description: The total cost of radio ads and social media ads cannot exceed the AdvertisingBudget.
The number of radio ads must be at least MinRadioAds and at most MaxRadioAds.
At least MinSocialMediaAds social media ads must be contracted.

objective.description: Maximize total exposure, which is the sum of expected viewers from radio ads and social media ads, while remaining within the advertising budget and satisfying constraints on the number of each type of advertisement.
